meeting_annotations.speaker: Jin Zhang
meeting_annotations.transcript: Hi everyone, welcome to the meeting. Today we're going to talk about the project progress and the next steps.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Candace Fleischer
meeting_annotations.transcript: So I think one of the things that we've been thinking about is how to best integrate the data sets that we have. So we have the genomic data, we have the proteomic data, and we have the clinical data. And I think one of the challenges is that these data sets are not always aligned. So we need to figure out how to best integrate them so that we can get a more complete picture of what's going on.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Lingyan Shi
meeting_annotations.transcript: [Interruption] Yeah, I think that's a great point. And I think one of the things that we need to think about is how to best normalize the data so that we can compare it across different data sets. Because right now, the data is not normalized, so it's really hard to compare it across different data sets. And I think that's something that we need to address before we can start integrating the data.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Candace Fleischer
meeting_annotations.transcript: Yeah, I agree. I think that's a really important point. And I think one of the things that we need to think about is how to best account for batch effects. meeting_annotations.speaker: Jin Zhang
meeting_annotations.transcript: Okay, so it sounds like we all agree that data normalization and batch effects are important issues to address. How do we want to approach this? Should we start by looking at different normalization methods and see which one works best for our data?

meeting_annotations.speaker: Candace Fleischer
meeting_annotations.transcript: Yeah, I think that's a good idea.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Jin Zhang
meeting_annotations.transcript: Okay, great.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Candace Fleischer
meeting_annotations.transcript: So I think one of the things that we could do is to look at some of the existing normalization methods that are out there. meeting_annotations.speaker: Jin Zhang
meeting_annotations.transcript: Okay, that sounds good. So Candace, do you want to take the lead on that and start looking at different normalization methods?

meeting_annotations.transcript: Yeah, I can definitely do that.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Jin Zhang
meeting_annotations.transcript: Okay, perfect. So it sounds like we have a plan for how to address data normalization and batch effects. Let's aim to have some preliminary results by our next meeting in two weeks. Does that sound good to everyone?
